channel.title: Comments on: Getting Started with Phonegap Desktop App (v0.1.1 Beta)
channel.description: Knowing is different & Doing is different

For #2 take a look at : /phonegap-quick-start/
Misc : /build-native-installers-using-ionic-cli/

item.title: By: Ibrahim
item.dc:creator: Ibrahim
item.description: How do i go about the cli and for the second option which folder will i upload? do i need any other file Thanks
item.content:encoded:
How do i go about the cli and for the second option which folder will i upload? do i need any other file
Thanks

item.title: By: tyler mackenzie
item.dc:creator: tyler mackenzie
item.description: I believe you basically have two options. you can download and use the GhoneGap cli (harder) or use adobe's PhoneGap Build service (easy) they let you build 1 free app. https://build.phonegap.com/
item.content:encoded: I believe you basically have two options. you can download and use the GhoneGap cli (harder) or use adobe’s PhoneGap Build service (easy) they let you build 1 free app. https://build.phonegap.com/

item.title: By: tyler mackenzie
item.dc:creator: tyler mackenzie
item.description: Hello, thanks for the great little tutorial. I just have a question about the folder structure that PhoneGap creates. I noticed that it creates html,js,css,etc files in the /www folder, and in /platforms/browser and in /platforms/browser/www. why are the same set of files there 3 times? and if I want to practice making a basic app by editing this default, which files do i need to edit? and which files do i need to upload to PhoneGap Build? thanks!
item.content:encoded: Hello, thanks for the great little tutorial. I just have a question about the folder structure that PhoneGap creates. I noticed that it creates html,js,css,etc files in the /www folder, and in /platforms/browser and in /platforms/browser/www. why are the same set of files there 3 times? and if I want to practice making a basic app by editing this default, which files do i need to edit? and which files do i need to upload to PhoneGap Build? thanks!

item.title: By: Ibrahim
item.dc:creator: Ibrahim
item.description: How do i generate the apk file?
item.content:encoded: How do i generate the apk file?

item.title: By: deltadan79
item.dc:creator: deltadan79
item.description: Quick question. After building the app using the desktop version, testing, and it works. Is there a way to package the app for distribution other than the buld.phonegap.com site? I have an app that plays audio from files that are stored within the app itself (rather large) and the build service from phonegap using zips limits the file size of uploaded archives.
item.content:encoded: Quick question. After building the app using the desktop version, testing, and it works. Is there a way to package the app for distribution other than the buld.phonegap.com site? I have an app that plays audio from files that are stored within the app itself (rather large) and the build service from phonegap using zips limits the file size of uploaded archives.

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description: Is your mobile and your desktop connected to the same wifi network?
item.content:encoded: Is your mobile and your desktop connected to the same wifi network?

item.title: By: 2-3-34
item.description: my PhoneGap developers app won't connect with my PhoneGap desktop app. Do you know how it could possibly connect? thank you any help is appreciated.
item.content:encoded: my PhoneGap developers app won’t connect with my PhoneGap desktop app. Do you know how it could possibly connect? thank you any help is appreciated.

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description: The last I checked this was not added as part of the Phonegap desktop app. You may need to either use Phonegap build or you can use Cordova API to generate the installer.
item.content:encoded: The last I checked this was not added as part of the Phonegap desktop app. You may need to either use Phonegap build or you can use Cordova API to generate the installer.

item.content:encoded: Not sure if the Desktop app is build using nwk. If it is so, it would be really cool to see how it performs in realtime! Yeah Linux people have to wait.

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description: Nope, this is for building mobile hybrid apps using Phonegap API, without the hassle of installing and setting up Phonegap CLI on your machine (<a href="/phonegap-3-cli-setup-mac-windows/" rel="nofollow">PhoneGap 3 CLI Setup on Mac & Windows</a>)
item.content:encoded: Nope, this is for building mobile hybrid apps using Phonegap API, without the hassle of installing and setting up Phonegap CLI on your machine (PhoneGap 3 CLI Setup on Mac & Windows)

item.title: By: YdnasErriep

item.description: nice !! it's just a wrapper for nodeWebkit(nw.js)??
item.content:encoded: nice !! it’s just a wrapper for nodeWebkit(nw.js)??
